CImage Class Reference

#include <serverimage.h>

Inheritance diagram for CImage:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

CImage. An instance of class CImage encapsulates the functionality of the bouncing square on the screen.

Definition at line 52 of file serverimage.h.

TInt CImage::CommandReplyL (  TInt  aCommand,
TAny *  aArgs
) 
 

CommandReplyL() Perform aCommand with optional additional arguments aArgs and return a reply (called by windows server). Note! This method can return an error, so any actions that can leave should use this method and not Command (). This command is not buffered and so requests from the client side are performed immediately. For these reason these functions should not take a long time.

Parameters:
aCommand the command to perform
aArgs any additional arguments required.

Definition at line 196 of file serverimage.cpp.

00197     {
00198     return aOpcode;
00199     }

void CImage::Command (  TInt  aCommand,
TAny *  aArgs
) 
 

Command() Perform aCommand with optional additional arguments aArgs. Note! Because there is no way to return an error from this method, it is important that these commands should not be able to fail or leave. This command is buffered and so may have been requested by the client side an unknown period ago.

Parameters:
aCommand the command to perform
aArgs any additional arguments required

Definition at line 206 of file serverimage.cpp.

00140 
00141     // if the last position has been drawn, update the position
00142     if ( iDrawn )

00144         // this position has not been drawn, so clear the flag

00150 
00151         // Check current position, 
00152         // reverse the direction if either limit is reached
00153         if ( ( iNewPoint.iX == iScreenSize.iTl.iX ) ||
00154            ( ( iNewPoint.iX + iSize.iWidth ) == iScreenSize.iBr.iX ) )
00155             {
00156             iDeltaX = -iDeltaX;
00157             }
00158 
00159         // Setup the next X coordinate
00160         iNewPoint.iX += iDeltaX;
00161 
00162         // Repeat for y coordinate
00163         if ( ( iNewPoint.iY == iScreenSize.iTl.iY ) ||
00164            ( ( iNewPoint.iY + iSize.iHeight ) == iScreenSize.iBr.iY ) )
00165             {
00166             iDeltaY = -iDeltaY;
00167             }
00168         iNewPoint.iY += iDeltaY;
00169 
00170         // Check for user requested reset
00171         if ( iAnimationReset )
00172             {
00173             iNewPoint.iX = 1;
00174             iNewPoint.iY = 1;
00175             iDeltaX = KStepSize;
00176             iDeltaY = KStepSize;
00177             iAnimationReset = EFalse;
00178             }
00179

00182         // windows emulator, simply uncomment and recompile

00184         //Redraw();
00185 
00186         // Force a draw to be performed by declaring the screen invalid
